name: K2-150
scenarioDescription:
The K2-150 Exoplanetary System

K2-150 is a star with 0.46 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.44 times its radius. It is located 358.77 light years away from the solar system.

K2-150 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-150 b

K2-150 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.59 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-150.

The mass of K2-150 b is 5.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-150 b is 2 that of Earth. At 5.05 Earth masses, K2-150 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-150, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
